thread.section_title: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger speaks out over Serge Gnabry transfer rumours – Metro
thread.title: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger speaks out over Serge Gnabry transfer rumours
thread.title_full: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger speaks out over Serge Gnabry transfer rumours

author: Tom Olver
title: Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger speaks out over Serge Gnabry transfer rumours
text:
Could Serge Gnabry re-sign for Arsenal? (Picture: Getty) Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger has responded to speculation linking Serge Gnabry with a sensational return to the Emirates.
Granit Xhaka receives dressing down from Arsene Wenger following racism accusation Gnabry has scored seven goals in 15 appearances for Werder Bremen following the 21-year-old’s £5million transfer move to the Weser-Stadion at the end of August.
The Germany winger only managed 18 first-team games for the Gunners from 2012 to 2016 but his barnstorming form in the Bundesliga has attracted interest from a number of top European clubs.
But it appears Wenger is not interested in re-signing Gnabry just yet, despite the youngster’s renaissance in Germany.
Arsene Wenger has responded following the transfer rumours (Picture: Getty) ‘No we’ve sold Serge definitely to Bremen,’ Wenger told the media ahead of Arsenal’s FA Cup clash away at Southampton.
More: Football Gary Neville lays into Anthony Martial and offers him some advice 
Revealed: Discover which Premier League club has the strongest worldwide fanbase 
Jurgen Klopp delivers the WORST excuse ever after Liverpool's EFL Cup exit 
At the time it looked like Bayern Munich were behind it.
‘At the moment no, we don’t resign him.’
MORE: Xhaka receives dressing down from Wenger after racism accusation
